column5: Here we go... It's been a long wait but here are some more underwater pike strikes. I was able to do some color editing so this new video has much more realistic colors. More underwater videos coming up after the summer as well. The camera seems like the best bait haha but If anyone has any ideas or baits you want me to record this summer let me know.https://youtu.be/95mgBOfjNjo
Thankyou, that was very fun to watch !!!

Very interesting to watch to see how long they will follow a lure prior to striking. Put some trailing meat on a lure some time and see if that shortens the evaluation time. I wonder if they are trying to pick up on scent?
Thanks, everyone, I will try the meat this summer and see.
perfect examples of why you want to throw a pause in there about every 5th handle turn. Forces the fish to make a decision.

Cool video. I have learned pulling shad raps for walleyes, that pike usually hit from behind racing toward the boat and walleye must hit from the side or bottom. You can always tell a pike because your line goes slack for an instance as they come from behind at a high rate of speed and typically walleye just grab it and and the rod bends.
